Package grafioschtrader.repository

Interface AssetclassJpaRepository

All Superinterfaces:

public interface AssetclassJpaRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Assetclass,Integer>, AssetclassJpaRepositoryCustom, UpdateCreateJpaRepository<Assetclass>

  • Method Details

    • getInvestableAssetclassesByWatchlist

      @Query("SELECT DISTINCT(a) FROM Watchlist w JOIN w.securitycurrencyList s JOIN s.assetClass a WHERE w.idTenant = ?1 AND w.idWatchlist = ?2\nAND a.specialInvestmentInstrument NOT IN (4,10)") List<Assetclass> getInvestableAssetclassesByWatchlist(Integer idTenant, Integer idWatchlist)
      Retrieves all asset classes in the specified watchlist that are investable, excluding CFDs and non-investable indices. CFD may not support algorithmic trading.
      Parameters:
      idTenant - the tenant ID owning the watchlist
      idWatchlist - the watchlist ID
      Returns:
      a list of Assetclass entities with specialInvestmentInstrument not in (4, 10)

    • findByCategorySpecInvestmentSubCategory

      @Query(value="SELECT a.*, s.* FROM assetclass a, multilinguestrings s WHERE a.category_type = ?1 AND a.spec_invest_instrument = ?2 AND s.text = ?3\nAND s.language = ?4 and a.sub_category_nls = s.id_string", nativeQuery=true) Assetclass findByCategorySpecInvestmentSubCategory(Byte categoryType, Byte specInvestment, String subCategory, String language)
      Finds an asset class by category type, special investment instrument, and localized sub-category.
      Parameters:
      categoryType - the asset class category type code
      specInvestment - the special investment instrument code
      subCategory - the sub-category text to match
      language - the language code for the sub-category localization
      Returns:
      the matching Assetclass entity, or null if none found

    • assetclassHasSecurity

      @Query(value="SELECT (CASE WHEN EXISTS(SELECT NULL FROM security s WHERE s.id_asset_class = a.id_asset_class)THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS has_security\nFROM assetclass a WHERE a.id_asset_class = ?1", nativeQuery=true) int assetclassHasSecurity(Integer idAssetClass)
      Checks whether any Security exists for the given asset class.
      Parameters:
      idAssetClass - the asset class ID to check
      Returns:
      1 if at least one Security references the asset class, 0 otherwise

    • assetclassesHasSecurity

      @Query(value="SELECT a.id_asset_class, (CASE WHEN EXISTS(SELECT NULL FROM security s WHERE s.id_asset_class = a.id_asset_class)\nTHEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS has_security FROM assetclass a", nativeQuery=true) List<Object[]> assetclassesHasSecurity()
      Determines for each asset class whether it has any associated Security records. Used to decide whether an asset class can still be deleted.
      Returns:
      a list of Object arrays, where each array contains: [0] = asset class ID (Integer), [1] = has_security flag (Integer, 1 if true, 0 if false)

    • getUnusedAssetclassForAlgo

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<Assetclass> getUnusedAssetclassForAlgo(Integer idTenant, Integer idAlgoAssetclassSecurity)
      Retrieves all asset classes not yet assigned to the specified algorithmic asset‐class, excluding margin instruments (CFD, spec_invest_instrument = 4).
      Parameters:
      idTenant - the tenant ID owning the algorithmic asset‐class
      idAlgoAssetclassSecurity - the algorithmic asset‐class security ID
      Returns:
      a list of Assetclass entities available for assignment

    • getPossibleAssetclassForExistingSecurity

      @Query(nativeQuery=true) List<Assetclass> getPossibleAssetclassForExistingSecurity(Integer idSecuritycurrency)
      Finds asset classes matching the category and instrument type of an existing security that has transaction history. If a security has a transaction, the category and type of instrument can no longer be changed. Return of all asset classes that are still possible, if transaction exists.

      The method:

      • Determines the asset class of the given Security (if it has any transactions)
      • Returns all asset classes with the same category_type and spec_invest_instrument
      Parameters:
      idSecuritycurrency - the ID of the Security to base the search on
      Returns:
      a list of Assetclass entities compatible with the security’s classification
